IEmailRecoveryManager.RecoveryConfig","name":"recoveryConfig","type":"tuple"}],"name":"updateRecoveryConfig","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"verifier","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"verifierAddr","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"The underlying EmailAccountRecovery contract provides some base logic for deploying guardian contracts and handling email verification. This contract defines an implementation for email-based recovery. It is designed to provide the core logic for email based account recovery that can be used across different modular account implementations. EmailRecoveryManager relies on a dedicated recovery module to execute a recovery attempt. This (EmailRecoveryManager) contract defines \"what a valid recovery attempt is for an account\", and the recovery module defines \u201chow that recovery attempt is executed on the account\u201d. A specific email subject handler is also accociated with a recovery manager. A subject handler defines and validates the recovery email subjects. Developers can write their own subject handlers to make specifc subjects for recovering modules","kind":"dev","methods":{"acceptanceSubjectTemplates()":{"details":"This is retrieved from the associated subject handler. Developers can write their own subject handlers, this is useful for account implementations which require different data in the subject or if the email should be in a language that is not English.","returns":{"_0":"string[][] A two-dimensional array of strings, where each inner array represents a set of fixed strings and matchers for a subject template."}},"addGuardian(address,uint256)":{"details":"This function can only be called by the account associated with the guardian and only if no recovery is in process","params":{"guardian":"The address of the guardian to be added","weight":"The weight assigned to the guardian"}},"cancelRecovery()":{"details":"Deletes the current recovery request associated with the caller's account"},"changeThreshold(uint256)":{"details":"This function can only be called by the account associated with the guardian config and only if no recovery is in process","params":{"threshold":"The new threshold for guardian approvals"}},"completeRecovery(address,bytes)":{"details":"Validates the recovery request by checking the total weight, that the delay has passed, and the request has not expired. Triggers the recovery module to perform the recovery. This function deletes the recovery request but recovery config state is maintained so future recovery requests can be made without having to reconfigure everything","params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the recovery is being completed","recoveryData":"The data that is passed to recover the validator or account. recoveryData = abi.encode(validatorOrAccount, recoveryFunctionCalldata). Although, it is possible to design a recovery module using this manager without encoding the validator or account, depending on how the handler.parseRecoveryDataHash() and module.recover() functions are implemented"}},"computeAcceptanceTemplateId(uint256)":{"details":"Encodes the email account recovery version ID, \"ACCEPTANCE\", and the template index, then uses keccak256 to hash these values into a uint ID.","params":{"templateIdx":"The index of the acceptance subject template."},"returns":{"_0":"uint The computed uint ID."}},"computeEmailAuthAddress(address,bytes32)":{"details":"This function utilizes the `Create2` library to compute the address. The computation uses a provided account address to be recovered, account salt, and the hash of the encoded ERC1967Proxy creation code concatenated with the encoded email auth contract implementation address and the initialization call data. This ensures that the computed address is deterministic and unique per account salt.","params":{"accountSalt":"A bytes32 salt value defined as a hash of the guardian's email address and an account code. This is assumed to be unique to a pair of the guardian's email address and the wallet address to be recovered.","recoveredAccount":"The address of the account to be recovered."},"returns":{"_0":"address The computed address."}},"computeRecoveryTemplateId(uint256)":{"details":"Encodes the email account recovery version ID, \"RECOVERY\", and the template index, then uses keccak256 to hash these values into a uint256 ID.","params":{"templateIdx":"The index of the recovery subject template."},"returns":{"_0":"uint The computed uint ID."}},"configureRecovery(address[],uint256[],uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Can only be called once for configuration. Sets up the guardians, and validates config parameters, ensuring that no recovery is in process. It is possible to configure guardians at a later stage if neccessary","params":{"delay":"The delay period before recovery can be executed","expiry":"The expiry time after which the recovery attempt is invalid","guardians":"An array of guardian addresses","threshold":"The threshold weight required for recovery","weights":"An array of weights corresponding to each guardian"}},"dkim()":{"details":"This function is virtual and can be overridden by inheriting contracts.","returns":{"_0":"address The address of the DKIM contract."}},"emailAuthImplementation()":{"details":"This function is virtual and can be overridden by inheriting contracts.","returns":{"_0":"address The address of the email authentication contract implementation."}},"extractRecoveredAccountFromAcceptanceSubject(bytes[],uint256)":{"details":"This is retrieved from the associated subject handler.","params":{"subjectParams":"The subject parameters of the acceptance email.","templateIdx":"The index of the acceptance subject template."}},"extractRecoveredAccountFromRecoverySubject(bytes[],uint256)":{"details":"This is retrieved from the associated subject handler.","params":{"subjectParams":"The subject parameters of the recovery email.","templateIdx":"The index of the recovery subject template."}},"getGuardian(address,address)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the account associated with the guardian","guardian":"The address of the guardian"},"returns":{"_0":"GuardianStorage The guardian storage details for the specified guardian and account"}},"getGuardianConfig(address)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the guardian configuration is being retrieved"},"returns":{"_0":"GuardianConfig The guardian configuration for the specified account"}},"getRecoveryConfig(address)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the recovery configuration is being retrieved"},"returns":{"_0":"RecoveryConfig The recovery configuration for the specified account"}},"getRecoveryRequest(address)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the recovery request details are being retrieved"},"returns":{"_0":"RecoveryRequest The recovery request details for the specified account"}},"handleAcceptance((uint256,bytes[],uint256,(string,bytes32,uint256,string,bytes32,bytes32,bool,bytes)),uint256)":{"details":"This function validates the email auth message, deploys a new EmailAuth contract as a proxy if validations pass and initializes the contract.","params":{"emailAuthMsg":"The email auth message for the email send from the guardian.","templateIdx":"The index of the subject template for acceptance, which should match with the subject in the given email auth message."}},"handleRecovery((uint256,bytes[],uint256,(string,bytes32,uint256,string,bytes32,bytes32,bool,bytes)),uint256)":{"details":"Verify the provided email auth message for a deployed guardian's EmailAuth contract and a specific subject template for recovery. Requires that the guardian is already deployed, and the template ID corresponds to the `templateId` in the given email auth message. Once validated.","params":{"emailAuthMsg":"The email auth message for recovery.","templateIdx":"The index of the subject template for recovery, which should match with the subject in the given email auth message."}},"isActivated(address)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the account for which the activation status is being checked"},"returns":{"_0":"bool True if the recovery request is activated, false otherwise"}},"recoverySubjectTemplates()":{"details":"This is retrieved from the associated subject handler. Developers can write their own subject handlers, this is useful for account implementations which require different data in the subject or if the email should be in a language that is not English.","returns":{"_0":"string[][] A two-dimensional array of strings, where each inner array represents a set of fixed strings and matchers for a subject template."}},"removeGuardian(address)":{"details":"This function can only be called by the account associated with the guardian and only if no recovery is in process","params":{"guardian":"The address of the guardian to be removed"}},"updateRecoveryConfig((uint256,uint256))":{"details":"Validates and sets the new recovery configuration for the caller's account, ensuring that no recovery is in process.","params":{"recoveryConfig":"The new recovery configuration to be set for the caller's account"}},"verifier()":{"details":"This function is virtual and can be overridden by inheriting contracts.","returns":{"_0":"address The address of the verifier contract."}}},"title":"EmailRecoveryManager","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"MINIMUM_RECOVERY_WINDOW()":{"notice":"Minimum required time window between when a recovery attempt becomes valid and when it becomes invalid"},"acceptanceSubjectTemplates()":{"notice":"Returns a two-dimensional array of strings representing the subject templates for an acceptance by a new guardian."},"addGuardian(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Adds a guardian for the caller's account with a specified weight"},"cancelRecovery()":{"notice":"Cancels the recovery request for the caller's account"},"changeThreshold(uint256)":{"notice":"Changes the threshold for guardian approvals for the caller's account"},"completeRecovery(address,bytes)":{"notice":"Completes the recovery process for a given account. This is the forth and final core function that must be called during the end-to-end recovery flow. Can be called by anyone."},"computeAcceptanceTemplateId(uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates a unique subject template ID for an acceptance subject template using its index."},"computeEmailAuthAddress(address,bytes32)":{"notice":"Computes the address for email auth contract using the CREATE2 opcode."},"computeRecoveryTemplateId(uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates a unique ID for a recovery subject template using its index."},"configureRecovery(address[],uint256[],uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Configures recovery for the caller's account. This is the first core function that must be called during the end-to-end recovery flow"},"dkim()":{"notice":"Returns the address of the DKIM contract."},"emailAuthImplementation()":{"notice":"Returns the address of the email auth contract implementation."},"extractRecoveredAccountFromAcceptanceSubject(bytes[],uint256)":{"notice":"Extracts the account address to be recovered from the subject parameters of an acceptance email."},"extractRecoveredAccountFromRecoverySubject(bytes[],uint256)":{"notice":"Extracts the account address to be recovered from the subject parameters of a recovery email."},"getGuardian(address,address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the guardian storage details for a given guardian and account"},"getGuardianConfig(address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the guardian configuration for a given account"},"getRecoveryConfig(address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the recovery configuration for a given account"},"getRecoveryRequest(address)":{"notice":"Retrieves the recovery request details for a given account"},"handleAcceptance((uint256,bytes[],uint256,(string,bytes32,uint256,string,bytes32,bytes32,bool,bytes)),uint256)":{"notice":"Handles an acceptance by a new guardian."},"handleRecovery((uint256,bytes[],uint256,(string,bytes32,uint256,string,bytes32,bytes32,bool,bytes)),uint256)":{"notice":"Processes the recovery based on an email from the guardian."},"isActivated(address)":{"notice":"Checks if the recovery is activated for a given account"},"recoverySubjectTemplates()":{"notice":"Returns a two-dimensional array of strings representing the subject templates for email recovery."},"removeGuardian(address)":{"notice":"Removes a guardian for the caller's account"},"subjectHandler()":{"notice":"The subject handler that returns and validates the subject templates"},"updateRecoveryConfig((uint256,uint256))":{"notice":"Updates and validates the recovery configuration for the caller's account"},"verifier()":{"notice":"Returns the
